description: Expert in modern ABAP Cloud development following clean core principles with focus on cloud-ready APIs and extensibility patterns.
Advanced expertise in building RAP-based business objects using managed and unmanaged scenarios with behavior definitions, actions, validations, and determinations.
Comprehensive experience creating transactional, analytical, and consumption CDS views with proper annotations for Fiori Elements.
Strong foundation in OO design patterns, encapsulation, and modern ABAP development practices.
Experience developing high-performance database procedures for complex calculations and data-intensive operations.
Expert in building List Report, Object Page, and Analytical List Page applications with UI annotations and customizations.
Proficient in UI5 framework, custom controls, data binding, and extending Fiori Elements applications.
Deep understanding of SAP Fiori UX design principles and implementation of consistent user experiences.
Skilled in designing and implementing iFlows for system integration with message mapping, error handling, and monitoring.
Expert in creating and consuming OData V2 and V4 services for system integration and Fiori applications.
Experience configuring and troubleshooting IDoc interfaces for SAP system communication.
Proficient in designing and consuming RESTful APIs for cloud and on-premise integrations.
Experience building side-by-side extensions, using BTP services, and cloud-native development on SAP BTP.
Skilled in HANA performance tuning, CDS view optimization, and code pushdown techniques.
Comprehensive experience across greenfield, brownfield, and hybrid S/4HANA implementations.
Experience using ATC for S/4HANA readiness checks and code quality analysis.
Daily use of ABAP Development Tools for modern development workflows including CDS, RAP, and debugging.
Version control expertise with Git workflows for collaborative development.
Growing expertise in building cloud-native applications with CAP using Node.js and CDS.
Deep understanding of extensibility concepts, side-by-side extensions, and maintaining upgradability.
